{"step_by_step_thinking": "The quadruple test for antenatal detection of Down syndrome includes four markers. According to Document [0], Document [3], Document [9], and Document [11], these markers are AFP (alpha-fetoprotein), hCG (human chorionic gonadotropin), uE3 (unconjugated estriol), and inhibin A. Therefore, the marker that is not part of the quadruple test is Inhibin B.", "answer_choice": "D"}
